channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Manitoba municipalities renew calls for province to review mental health legislation
item.description: Winnipeg police have also voiced support for an approach that would see mental health groups take the lead on non-violent calls.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada can regain its measles elimination status. Here’s how
item.description: On Monday, the Pan American Health Organization revoked the measles-free status Canada has had since 1998 because an outbreak has lasted for more than a year.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario, feds agree to 1-year child-care extension; average fee to stay $19/day
item.description: The program that lowers parents' child-care fees — now $19 a day on average in Ontario as an interim step toward $10 — had been set to expire March 31.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: LIVE UPDATES: Canada marks Remembrance Day with ceremonies honouring veterans, fallen soldiers
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: National Remembrance Day ceremony to mark 80 years since WWII
item.description: Canada will observe Remembrance Day with events being held across the country, honouring the country's veterans and marking 80 years since the end of the Second World War.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Introduces Legislation to Provide Tax Relief to Manufacturers

item.title: Manitoba Government's Mineral Development Fund Supports Future Mining Opportunities

item.title: Manitoba Government Completed 23 Summer Infrastructure Projects

item.title: Labour Minister tells Ford-friendly union it will be tapped to build Hwy. 401 tunnel
item.description: In a video posted to social media, Labour Minister David Piccini told members of a private sector union they'd be tapped to build Hwy. 413 and the 401 tunnel.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Fast, agile’ wild turkeys flocking on Ontario roadway prompts safety warning
item.description: Officials in St. Catharines, Ont., are warning motorists to use caution when near highways as groups of wild turkeys are flocking to the roads.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Water From Your Eyes bring chaotic brilliance to the Biltmore Cabaret
item.description: Get the best of Vancouver in your inbox, every Tuesday and Thursday. Sign up for our free newsletter.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
